description:
[酒](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/酒) refers to any alcoholic drink, but China has its own long history of liquor, including wine and beer. In fact, Chinese restaurants are often advertised as [酒家](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/酒家) (*liquor house*).

**Characters**

Looking at the components of the character [酒](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/酒), [氵](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/氵) is the radical for *water* (if you see this on a character, it probably has to do with something liquid), and [酉](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/酉) resembles a wine vessel.

酒 is also Japanese (kanji) for sake.
[白](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/白) means *white*, and [酒](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/酒) is *liquor*, so [白酒](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/白酒) is *white liquor*.
